Package org.thewhitemage13.processor

Class PostProcessor

java.lang.Object
org.thewhitemage13.processor.PostProcessor
All Implemented Interfaces:
PostProcessorInterface
@Component public class PostProcessor extends Object implements PostProcessorInterface
Processor responsible for converting Post entities into CreatePostDTO and generating PostEvent for post-related actions.

This component handles the transformation of post entities into DTOs for use in the service layer and also prepares post events that encapsulate post details for event-driven workflows such as publishing or deleting posts.

Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Mukhammed Lolo

  • Method Details

    • getPostDTOS

      public List<CreatePostDTO> getPostDTOS(List<Post> posts)
      Converts a list of Post entities to a list of CreatePostDTO.

      This method iterates through the provided list of Post objects and maps each post's attributes (e.g., media URL, content, and user ID) into a CreatePostDTO. This transformation is necessary for handling post data in a DTO format that can be used by the frontend or other layers of the system.

      Specified by:
      getPostDTOS in interface PostProcessorInterface
      Parameters:
      posts - a list of Post entities to be converted to DTOs
      Returns:
      a list of CreatePostDTO containing the post data

    • getPostEvent

      public org.thewhitemage13.PostEvent getPostEvent(Post deletePost)
      Converts a Post entity to a PostEvent for post-related events.

      This method takes a Post entity and generates a PostEvent, which contains key details about the post, such as post ID, user ID, content, media URL, and timestamps. The resulting event object is typically used for event-driven architectures to notify other services about post changes or deletions.

      Specified by:
      getPostEvent in interface PostProcessorInterface
      Parameters:
      deletePost - the Post entity to be converted into an event
      Returns:
      a PostEvent containing the relevant post details
